author: {'steamid': '76561198186530370', 'num_games_owned': 2632, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 1947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1947, 'last_played': 1697792359}
review:
"While this game exhibits a promising concept, it still feels like a work in progress given the multitude of glitches and shortcomings.

Pros:

o The core concept is engaging, with a quick base-building system that allows for potential comebacks when resources are available.
o It's easy to grasp and get into.



Cons:

o Ships often experience severe shaking when attempting to move, and there are instances when they won't respond as expected, especially when part of a larger group.

o The AI's performance in skirmishes is lackluster, as it sometimes makes peculiar decisions that lead to swift defeat, such as sending its starting construction ship into harm's way.

o Gameplay largely involves waiting for resources and ships to accumulate, while the AI fails to present a meaningful challenge. However, if you encroach on their territory prematurely, they send overwhelmingly powerful waves to crush you.

o The game is plagued by various glitches that can lead to game freezes, necessitating relaunches.

o Research points are scarce in the early stages, but later, they become abundant, yet there's often an insufficient number of useful research options.

In summary, if you can overlook or endure these issues, or if future patches address these problems, the game has the potential to be enjoyable."

author: {'steamid': '76561198048200319', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2232, 'last_played': 1540648186}
review:
Ещё одна игра от Camel 101, которую я с удовольствием прошёл.

Это космическая RTS с долгой, достаточно интересной и более чем сложной кампанией.

Игра подзаброшена в плане заплаток, и хотя мне удалось посмотреть-таки финальные титры, путь к ним был тернистым. Особую радость мне принёс баг с запретом на строительство дредноутов там, где это, по идее, разрешено.

По порядку: 3 стороны, планетарные и орбитальные сооружения, флот от крошечных до гигантских кораблей. Наикрутейшие - дредноуты - имеют активируемые способности, прокачиваются и вообще ведут себя героически. На корабли каждого класса есть ограничение по количеству, но итоговый размер флота может быть весьма впечатляющим.

Ближайшие аналоги игры, приходящие на ум: Sins of the Solar Empire и Haegemonia: Legions of Iron: для увеличения численности войск и притока ресурсов вам необходимо колонизировать планеты, хотя в Gemini Wars бывают разноплановые уровни, и не всё привязано к околопланетным действиям.

Главную ставку игра делает на продолжительную историю, где нам предстоит сопровождать, атаковать, строить базы и флот, даже сражаться с "боссами"-кораблями. Общий масштаб истории очень впечатляет, задания по-хорошему сложные, часто приходится мучительно, пробами и ошибками, искать единственно верную тактику. Не раз мне приходилось пользоваться багами, чтобы хоть как-то прорваться (вроде задания с одинокой космической станцией в последней трети). Даже стелс-миссии встречаются, всё как в лихих стратегиях из двухтысячных.

Экономическая составляющая примитивная, но сложная в том плане, что ресурсов очень мало. Одно из первых заданий, где вы возглавляете оборону планеты, исключительно сложное именно потому что вам необходимо бережно тратить свои средства, и выбор между оборонительными турелями и истребителями довольно непрост.

Внешне игра очень скромная, звуковое оформление не очень запомнилось, поэтому не стану комментировать.

Как мне показалось, интересная история, от начала до конца которой вы проведёте главного героя, многое искупает.
Здесь не самое удобное управление - скверный, кстати, недостаток, - немало ошибок и очень высокая сложность, но сыграть всё равно советую, тем более, что космических RTS в природе немного.

review:
A space opera strategy game from the golden years of the early 2010s, when there were plenty of options to choose from.
There aren't much these days, but we can always revisit some classics.
This one is a bit rough around the edges, but it's solid and fun to play. It has slow buildups where you have to grow your forces while keeping the enemies at bay, but then it gets intense when you gather a large fleet. You might get the upper hand, but you can lose everything quickly, if another enemy battlegroup arrives in the system. Ships jump from system to system, and have to recharge the engines before jumping again.
Multiplayer is dead of course, but it has a lengthy campaign and skirmish battles against cpu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022039830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1420, 'last_played': 1635447292}
review:
This one is a tough one to rate. But in 2019 the game got a large patch that fixed a lot of the reasons people gave it a thumbs down. The game is stable now and no longer requires a registration. Is it worth $15? No. I think if the dev lowered it to $5 he'd probably make a lot more money. 

The story is not original, pretty much follows the exact storyline and game mechanics as Haegemonia. Though, I will say Gemini Wars was a little easier to get into. Both games involve wars between humans in space and having to unite to combat an alien terror. Pretty much the same story as Descent Freespace or dozens of other games, movies, TV shows. It's a well-used trope and Gemini Wars didn't bring anything new to it, except maybe a small twist at the end which sets up a DLC or sequel that'll never come.  I like this trope though, it's one of my favorites. But the alien threat never felt mysterious and never felt personified making it kind of meh.

The UI is workable. My biggest complaint is camera angels. Maybe I just missed it, but I couldn't figure out how to rotate the camera. The second to last mission was definitely the worst with it almost impossible to see things correctly with only being maybe 15 degrees above the plane it was hard to click on the right objects.

The unit shaking is still there after the 2019 patch but not as much. I noticed it only a few times. Often though units would warp to the wrong point on the map. I can't tell you how many times I lost a ship because it went to the wrong warp point. Unit building allows a queue of 10 units, which is okay, but you have to manually find the structure to build more and when the maps began to take on multiple systems it got difficult to do so in a hurry. The last level for some reason many of the mining sectors I couldn't build mining facilities on, not sure what was up with that. Also, at least two of the achievements are bugged.

Overall a fun little campaign. Some UI issues detracted from the game. Graphics it's about what you'd expect for a 2012 indie game, which is fine because space with ships gives you more to work with. Unit roster is fine. There's really no reason to build frigates but destroyers, cruisers, battleships, and carriers each have a distinct role-- if there was a formations button I'd have built smaller missile frigates but they just raced ahead to die too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057362231', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1628065376}
review:
Gemini Wars is a good game with a solid science-fiction story. It doesn't deserve the bad rating. I tested this game in 2012 and completed the campaign back then. Now, about 10 years later, i am playing the full campaign again. There are some minor bugs in the game but none that prevent me from finishing the game. Some of the smaller bugs are solved by loading a save of the current game. Most of the negative reviews are on the drm (which was terrible but removed) and the slow pacing (but pressing B speeds up the game 4x when not in battle). 

I like that you don't have to restart searching everything during the campaign. Technology you already researched in a previous mission is still available. My favourite parts are the briefings, the different videos and the variety of the missions. Game has been done by a small team (indie game). I wish Sins of a Solar Empire had a campaign like this one. 

I am having fun with this game again. Thanks Camel101.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993957486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1537126364}
review:
I hate this game, because I could have spent those five hours playing something fun. This game isn't fun.

The screenshots and the trailer will show you big ships and big fleets and big battles, trying to make you think that's what this game is about. They're lying. This game is about waiting for your resource counter to uptick just enough to build another tiny ship that will ignore group move orders to go check out some incredibly interesting space dust.

About 80% of my time spent on this game was spent just waiting for the resource counter to uptick to the point where I could afford another [i]basic unit.[/i] That wait time might have been tolerable if they'd included a variable game speed option. They didn't.

There was a lot more playtesting needed here, because there's something very wrong with the basic setup. It's either that ships are too expensive, or resources just take too long to gather. Given the relative fragility of most units and the intolerable wait times between being able to build stations as well, I suspect it's actually both.

TL;DR: Don't buy this game. Don't even buy it on sale. Just ignore it and look for something else.

review:
Estratégia espacial um pouco alternativa, que mete alguns twists mecânicos pelo meio.
Este jogo já tem 6 anos, e de facto amadureceu bem.
Existem 3 facções, mas a campanha foca-se numa delas, mais especialmente no Captain Cole. 
Cole é o comandante, mas não está presente na batalha, ou seja, nao tem uma hero unit dedicada, é na prática um instrumento narrativo.
A acção é constante, mas envolve muita extracção de recursos para conseguir suportar as longas batalhas contra os vários inimigos. Ao inicio apenas se comanda pequenas frigates, mas eventualmente chega-se a naves bastante poderosas como battleships e carriers.
É um jogo muito bom para quem gosta deste estilo com scifi à mistura.

review:
A poor excuse for a space RTS. The tutorial was slow and boring and I was thankful when the game froze and I could get out of it. I tried going into the campaign and some things are explained. But the controls are awful. It's hard to select certain ships or particular types. It's hard to zoom in on one area and get the camera where you want. Everything is so small but with long ranges so you have to be zoomed out so much you're directing blips on a screen, not starships. Everything was poorly implemented and boring.

One positive is that the environments and space are gorgeous. The graphics definitely look old so I was surprised this was a 2012 release. But quality aside, the actual art and asthetic are great. 

Don't waste your time with this. Play Homeworld.

The audiovisuals are thematically fitting. It felt a lot like a clunkier and lower audiovisual production version of Stellaris, with less refined mechanics and less depth. I know the devs removed the DRM and this game might had been half alright at a given point. But given the alternatives on the market now there is really nothing to recommend it for. It is just too rehashed using carbon copy of concepts that have been featured over and over in the genre, and done better elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001839682', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1424462851}
review:
Very basic game for a 4x RTS. Way too basic.

The User interface is clunky at best. Theres no way to build units from a base structure except by zooming in to said structure and building it. Takes precious time, and is difficult to do if the building is surrounded by swarms of your own ships. No shortcut to select it, no empire tree or similar manager.

No hotkeys whatsoever and no settings for controls.

This is in space. SPACE. Despite that, unit maneuver are severely limited since there seem to be only two levels they can fly in. They cannot really fly over each other. Yes, this means that in a space game, you're restricted to x-y movement. No z-axis movement. It is odd to see that cruiser class ships are able to turn around on a dime in a short span of time... then not be able to move becuase of his two wingmen. Then all three of them try to figure out how to move for the next 30 seconds straight. 

Ship models are basically bricks with different lengths and very low detail. From what I've seen so far, most ships do not even have more than one weapon system (ie all the firepower from a destroyer comes from a SINGLE cannon).

Everything in the game screams overly simplistic. From the combat mechanics to the resource mechanics, to the user interface and the graphics (I'm usually not too concerned about graphics if the game is good, but on max graphics, weapon projectiles are VERY low resolution TEXTURES. COME ON. Homeworld 1 in 1998 had better projectiles with higher resolutions. For the Homeworld fans: One of the projectiles looks exactly like an energy weapon projectile from Homeworld Cataclysm, but lower resolution. This is 2012, not 1998).

As a long time fan of Homeworld, Sins of a Solar Empire and the space RTS genre in general, I cannot really recommend this game unless you enter with rock bottom expectations. Anything higher and you will be dissappointed. I didn't even have any expectations and then it disappointed me.

Risk it only if its on sale. Thats luckily how I got it, so it wasn't too much of a waste.

PS: The metacritic score for this game is 53. There's a reason for that, too bad I didn't listen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010077548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1618713773}
review:
Gemini Wars wirkt sehr unfertig. 
Die Story ist kaum der Rede wert und irgendwie hat man alles, was das Spiel bietet, schon sehr viel besser gesehen.
Scharmützel machen Spaß - Ein oder zwei Mal, dann hat man alles gesehen, alles gemacht. Wenn man den Bogen einmal raus hat, sind die Partien recht kurz. 
Der Forschungsbaum ist kaum als solcher zu bezeichnen. Es gibt nur ein paar Verbesserungen und immer größere Schiffklassen. Man forscht sich also zum Super-Schlachtschiff und zwingt den Gegner mit einer Armada dieser Großkampf-Pötte in die Knie. Allerdings sogen bugs dafür, dass ein einziges gegnerisches Jägergeschwader ausreicht, um unsere komplette Flotte aus Großkampfschiffen in Weltraumschrott zu verwandeln. Wer also keine eigenen Jäger hat und sich auf die FlaK der Kampfschiffe verlässt, wird sich wundern, wie schnell die von ein paar kaum sichtbaren Jägern zerschreddert werden. 
Sichtbarkeit ist ein gutes Stichwort. 90% der Zeit sieht man die taktische Karte, auf der die Flotten als kleine Symbole dargestellt werden. Da die Kämpfe allerdings höchst unspektakulär in Szene gesetzt sind, lohnt sich selbst kein zoom in die Schlacht. Große Finesse erfordern die Raumkämpfe nicht. Masse statt Klasse reicht völlig und dann kann kan die Flotte auch sich selbst überlassen, einen Kaffee in der Küche holen gehen und zum Sieg wieder zurück sein.
Theoretisch kann man einzelne Systeme der Schiffe gezielt angreifen und Gegner kampfunfähig schießen, um ihn dann per Angrifftrupp zu übernehmen aber das klappt in der Praxis dann nur im Handbuch. 
Ein wenig mehr Zeit der Entwickler mit ihrem Spiel hatte aus Gemini Wars sicher noch etwas machen können. So jedoch ist es beim guten Willen geblieben.
Was mir hingegen gut gefällt, ist die Musik während der Kämpfe. 

Fazit:
Für ein schnelles Gefecht zwischendurch sicher geeignet aber die Dinge die Gemini Wars anpreist sind einfach viel zu oberflächlich umgesetzt, um lange fesseln zu können. Dazu gesellen sich störende bugs und schlechte Übersichtlichkeit. 
Der Preis ist, für das was man erhält, völlig überzogen. Wer einen Blick riskieren will, der wartet besser darauf, dass Gemini Wars im Angebot ist und schlägt dann zu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044040894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1388692058}
review:
This game is extremely glitchy. Coming from someone who grew up playing Sins of A Solar Empire, Gemini Wars is essentially the same thing, with less smoother combat, and extremely unresponsive UI controls. In addition, the graphical design of the spaceships and buildings themselves are clearly composed of simple polygons and geometric vectors. I feel that this game is far from what description and videos say it is.

If you want a good space RTS game, this is definitely not the game to get. If anything, Sins of A Solar Empire is infinitely better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046103360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1389774425}
review:
This game feels like it is still in beta with all the glitches.

Pros:
    Good concept. I enjoy how quickly bases can be built if you have the resources which makes comebacks not entirely out of the picture. Easy to pick up.

Cons:
    Ships will shake violently when trying to move and sometimes won't even move when part of a large selected group. AI is horrible for skirmishes. I played a skirmish where the AI player sent its starting construction ship to where I was building my fleet about 5 minutes into the game and it was destroyed easily ending the game.
    Gameplay mostly involves waiting around for resources and ships to build up while the AI does nothing to stop you and then easily winning, but if you move into their space too early they send massivly overpowered waves to crush you.
    Full of glitches that simply freeze the game and make you have to re-launch. Research points are hard to come by at first, but then there isn't enough to research and you have an abundance of unuseable points.

If you can deal with all that is wrong with this game or if any patches come out to fix the many problems, then this is a decent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961109175', 'num_games_owned': 1706, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1388049242}
review:
This game is just bad. Not bad as in buggy,  or unfinished. Bad as in, just not fun, and down right boring. Although, it does have its share of bugs. I wasnt able to run it fullscreen without having the UI stop responding, and just to play the game single player, you have to create an online account that you log in with every time (just annoying).

You spend most of the game looking at your ships as little blue dots, not actual ship graphics. You have to zoom in to an unplayable level to even see your ships graphics. And combat is a snore fest. Even basic frigates last forever, even with 20 enemies blasting them. Takes forever for any ships to die.  Im ok with the bad voice acting, and mediocre graphics because the game is an indie game, but the rest of the game is just unacceptable as something I would play when Im looking to have fun.
